intro: Pachylobus zenkeri, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Pachylobus zenkeri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
